div.p: Boxplots showing the frequency distribution of the (a) temporal scale (study duration in years) and (b) spatial scale (study area in log km 2) for each research theme. Box colors represent the biological subdisciplines and physical/chemical discipline reported in the legends of FigsÂ 1 and 2. The horizontal line shows the median, and the lower and upper portions of the box represent the interquartile range (25th and 75th percentiles). The whiskers show the spread of values, excluding outliers. Circles and stars indicate outliers that are more than 1.5 and 3 box lengths, respectively, from one hinge of the box.
